description: Borrowed from French salep, from Turkish salep, from Arabic سَحْلَب‎ (saḥlab, “type of orchid”). According to the Oxford English Dictionary, the Arabic word is said to be a contraction of خُصَى الثَعْلَب‎ (ḵuṣā aṯ-ṯaʕlab, “fox testicles”) (الثَعْلَب‎ (aṯ-ṯaʕlab, “fox”) + خُصًى‎ (ḵuṣan, “testicles”)), referring to the testicle-like root tubers.

entries.meaning: A starch or jelly made out of plants in the Orchidaceae family, such as the early-purple orchid (Orchis mascula).
Alternative form of saloop (“aromatic drink originally made with salep”)
